page.title: 08FARMING IN HAMSTERLEY
page.content: Farming in the area is the major occupation,even though they are family units run with occasional help.The average farm is about 230 acres,is low intensive grassland,supporting mainly sheep.Owner occupation and tenancy are about equal.There has been a complete move from dairying since the introduction of E.E.C. regulations.A small number of beef cattle are reared.Grain and root crops occupy a very small proportion of land.Silage and hay are the main crops,to feed the stock through the winter. Areas of rough grazing are being drained and reclaimed for more intensive grazing.The moorland areas are common land which are utilised as pasture by local farmers.There is also an intensive pig farm,which supplies slurry to local farms.A new venture is a herd of milking Friesland sheep.
